document_data.name: Obliviasphere
document_data.mainbody: '''''Obliviasphere''''' was a [[spell]] that created a spherical barrier that rebounded spells as [[wild magic]].
document_data.Effects:
The spell generated a sphere of force no less than {{SI|14|feet|long=yes}} in diameter that, for ten minutes, blocked the passage of living creatures other than the caster into or out of it, and of all spells. When a spell or living creature tried to cross the sphere's boundary, they rebounded, and wild magic burst out of the sphere. For most spells, the burst of wild magic rebounded in a random direction, but living creatures were struck by the wild magic in full.

Of note, the wild magic could turn someone unlucky and close by into a [[myconid]].
document_data.Components: Besides [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s, the spell called for any part of a myconid, and a piece of rock crystal that was polished clear.
document_data.History: [[Azuth]] made this spell available through [[Elminster]] sometime prior to {{yearlink|1370}}.{{cite book/Secrets of the Magister|101}}
